resources.string: *All the fields are compulsory. Please bear with us

string-array.name: descriptions
string-array.item:
"Clothing is transformative."
When you put something really beautiful on,you feel something.It indicates the kind of person one is on the inside. The language of clothing is high symbolism.CSE United is known for its elegance,magnificence and decency.We expect each and everyone present at this event to be dressed befitting the honour of this event.Ethnic and formal dress codes are the most suitable dress codes.

"The art of communication is the language of leadership"
Language is what connects people around us.It is natural to treat people with respect and we abide by this rule. A warm smile is the universal language of kindness.The development of language is part of the development of the personality,for words are the natural means of expressing thoughts and establishing understanding between people. We believe in decent speaking culture throughout the event.

"Actions speak louder than words"
Proper etiquette,polite and mature behaviour is expected from everyone present at the event.Let us all make an effort to conduct this gala event peacefully and efficiently.

resources.string: "In the 5th year, CSE UNITED soared to an entirely new height. The event took place at the EZCC (Eastern Zonal Cultural Centre) Hall. For the first time, in five years, the event took place outside the college premises. Following our traditions, the hall was decorated, keeping in mind the significance of the celebration of the 5th year. Starting from the inauguration to the end, all the events had a cultural as well as a western touch to it. In addition, the Mr. and Miss CSE event was introduced this year."

"CSE United is our way of welcoming the first years to our family. What better than combine it with an alumni meet as, after all, in the words of our beloved CKB Sir, an institution is not known by its faculty but its alumni."

"This was the first alumni meet organised by the CSE Department of Techno India. The meet proved to be a success, and we had quite a few alumni members joining us to guide and inspire the first years. A Q-n-A session on various aspects of corporate life and academics was followed by fun events organised by the alumni members themselves. Students of the department also presented their take on the alumni website and the group led by Soumajit Biswas was declared the winner. The event came to an end with a light-hearted game of tug-of-war, with students of the first, second, third and fourth years as well as one consisting of members of the Alumni competing for the title."

"By 2012, CSE United had become a day everyone looks forward to. The second ever CSE Unted was held in late 2012 and consisted of the usual fare – songs, dances, games, etc. The events of the day included: Dance Performances by Russa and Smita, Deepika, Prema, Saurav Kothari
A group song by Jyotirmoy and his group. A recitation by Sayan, a fresher at the time. A recitation by Ritesh. A Song by Joydeep sir. A group song by Meghdut and his group. Songs by CKB sir and Poulami ma'am."

"The first ever CSE United was deviced as a cultural program to welcome freshers to the Computer Science and Engineering Department. The events of the day included:
A recitation by Ritesh. A song by Souvik and Subham. A group song by Meghdut. Dance performances by Saurav Kothari, Kavita and Deepika. A game of musical chair by the teachers. Interaction with first years. Songs by CKB sir and Poulami ma'am."

Being a part of the team as a Convener, ever since its inception and managing cultural affairs of a department of which I am a part of, since the last decade, is very valuable, prestigiousand special for me. I am personally very excited about the transformation that is underway at CSE, TISL where the focus is not only on “Innovative Learning”, to prepare students to be ready for the industry and research, but also on nurturing talent and boosting confidence and morale, to foster growth and sculpt professional leaders with high academic aptitude through a learner-centric system and advanced pedagogic methods. Having completed 5 years and into its sixth, it is my privilege and pleasure to bring out the first edition of the progress book for the event CSE United cum Alumni Meet. In this journey through dance, drama, music, integrating technology with culture, we have celebrated the achievements of our current students, basking in the pride of our alumni and ushered in the next batch of young and energetic aspirants to the department. In this endeavor we thrive to get better and leave our footprints in the caskets of one’s memories

CSE UNITED: - This is not just a yearly event, but a festive, a celebration, a pride of our department. I am extremely delighted to be a part of it. We, Department of CSE, strongly believe in the all-round development of the students- be it academics, personality or co-curricular activities. This is the platform where students can get an opportunity to show their talent beyond the syllabus. I want to compliment and congratulate the organizing committee and our beloved colleague Ms. Poulami Dutta, for their immense effort, without them this event could not be a success. I wish the students of CSE, who are the brand ambassadors and the torch bearers of this event, all the very best.

When CSE united was conceptualized in 2011, we never expected it to become such an extravaganza over these years. What started as a departmental get together in that November afternoon has now stepped outside the college premises and surely has become an annual gala that is a signature event for the CSE department that each and every one of us look forward to; indeed, a great achievement for a FIVE-year-old!! This event has sprung surprises on us over last five years; students turned into directors, we faculties had to follow scripts, dancers bloomed, students from first and last bench turned into finest actors to give life to some amazing scripts, musicians-vocal and instrumental alike scored every time they took the stage, and students from all four years cheered together and became one big family. The organizing team, under the very able guidance of Poulami Ma’am, across these years, has seen different faces, but all of them have been the same in spirit, that is to make it a little better. CKB Sir very rightly had sung ‘Sweetheart’ in the very first edition of the event, as this event truly has become a ‘Sweetheart’ of our department, and hopefully will remain so. I will take this opportunity to congratulate this event and the team behind it for completing the first five years, and wish all the luck for the coming editions; hoping to be a witness to many more of these. Godspeed!!

The “CSE UNITED” which was held on November 7th, 2015 was very successful and undoubtedly appreciated amongst the students and faculty members. The students of CSE Department had join in a lot of activities such as music and dance performances, drama etc. The event day was also visited by Honorable Co-Chairman, Smt. Manasi Roy Chowdhury, who held an inspiring speech and expressed her wish to make the event day a regular event. Many thanks to the organizing committee who spent several days of hard work, planning and preparing the event! Without the great efforts from students of all the years, the CSE united event would not have been this successful. A special thanks to Ms. Poulami Dutta, faculty of CSE department, who ambitiously coordinated the whole event and motivated so many students to take part in it.

I’d like to start by thanking to my entire department of CSE, honorable faculities, students and as well as all the alumni’s associated here. I’m sure you’d all agree, the whole event from the start to the finish was very well planned and executed to the fullest giving ample time and space to communicate, laugh and share which gave rise to a sense of belonging and oneness. I also take this opportunity to appreciate the strenuous efforts made by the committee who has worked so tirelessly to make it all such a success and especially Mrs. Poulami Dutta our delightful compare faculty who made sure everything ran so very well. Everyone was having a blast. May I not been a long time in this event but since I’ve been to a sit-down as a faculty and been a part of that event was that much fun! I only wish I could have been there to witness from the 1st day of its beginning. Again, thank you for letting us spread the word on WOW. From the last 4 years it has been going through smoothly but this year it was really superb I must say. I wish this event will be more successful and brightening as much as the scorching Sun rays in a pleasant summer’s day.
